result.execSummary:
All charges against Jordan Clayton in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jordan Clayton is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan Clayton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jordan Clayton in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Jordan Clayton.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a jury trial. State is unable to proceed. State has had no communication with the victim. Defense moves to dismiss. COURT ORDERED CASE DISMISSED.

Defendant Jordan Clayton in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Jordan Clayton.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pretrial. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Parties ready to proceed to trial. Court grants State's Motion in Limine. Court reviews Defense's Motion in Limine with the parties and grants paragraph 1,3-6, 15 except for sidebars, and 16-17. Paragraph 2, 8, and 9 is reserved. Paragraph 7, 10, and 11 is denied. Paragraph 12 is modified as discussed on the record. Paragraph 13 and 14 is as expressed on the record. Case remains calendared for Jury trial on September 19, 2022 at 9:00am in Branch 15, Room 623CH.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions; received and filed.

Case in court for a status conference. Due to a scheduling conflict, defense counsel did not appear. 
Defense requests case to be rescheduled for final pre-trial and jury trial dates.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Jordan Clayton not in court, in custody.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  OFF THE RECORD.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Domask has received discovery and an offer and would like time to review with his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jordan Clayton in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  

The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/7/22 @ 2:30p
